item.title: Deep Learning for Air Quality Prediction: From Data Cleaning to LSTMs.
item.description:
View Project on GitHub:

Part 1. The Importance of Data Cleaning in Environmental Analysis

Data is often called the backbone of ML, but in the real world, data is rarely clean or ready for use. This is especially true for environmental data, where missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies are common. When predicting PM10 pollution levels in Auckland (NZ), the first challenge wasnâ€™t building a model but cleaning the data. Imagine trying to build a house with warped bricks and missing mortar. Without proper cleaning, even the best models would struggle to produce meaningful results. In this part, I’ll explore the messy reality of working with air quality data and the critical role data cleaning played in this project.

item.title: Predicting Air Quality in Auckland (NZ): Harnessing AI to Tackle PM10 Pollution
item.description: This section showcases the various blog and technical posts related to this project.
